turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: This is weird, Mulder.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Very weird.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Any thoughts on why anybody'd be growing corn in the middle of the desert?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Not unless those are giant Jiffy Pop containers out there.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Cool in here. Temperature's being regulated.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: For the purpose of what?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You hear that?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I hear the humming. Like electricity. High voltage maybe.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Maybe. Maybe not.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Scully....?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Yeah...?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Run.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Where'd they go?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Salt Lake City, Utah. Transfer effective immediately.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I already gave Skinner my letter of resignation.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You can't quit, Scully.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I can, Mulder. I debated whether or not to even tell you in person, because I knew --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: We're close to something here -- we're on the verge --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: You're on the verge, Mulder -- please don't do this to me --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: After what you saw last night -- after all you've seen -- you can't just walk away --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I have. I did. It's done.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Just like that --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I'm contacting the state board Monday to file medical reinstatement papers --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I need you on this, Scully --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: You don't Mulder -- you've never needed me. I've only held you back.  I've got to go.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Why was I assigned to you? To debunk your work. To reign you in. To shut you down.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You saved me, Scully.  As different and frustrating as it's been sometimes, your goddamn strict rationalism and science have saved me a thousand times; have kept me honest and made me whole. I owe you so much, Scully, and you owe me nothing.  I don't want to do this without you. I don't know if I can. If I quit now, they win.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What? What happened?

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I think... something stung me.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Scully...

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Something's wrong...  I'm having -- lancinating pain -- my chest. My... motor functions are being affected. I'm...

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: ...my pulse feels thready and I've got a funny taste in the back of my throat.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I think you're in anaphylactic shock --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: No -- it's --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Scully --

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I've got no allergy. Something... this... Mulder... I think... I think you should call an ambulance.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Cold...

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Hang on. I'm going to get you out of here.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: We've got to keep moving.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: Where are we?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You got me. But I think I know what they did with Jimmy Hoffa.

turns.speaker: SCULLY
turns.text: I can't go any farther.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Yes you can. You're going to make it, Scully.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: We're going to the morgue.

turns.speaker: YOUNG NAVAL GUARD
turns.text: That area is currently off limits to anyone other than authorized medical personnel.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: On whose orders?

turns.speaker: YOUNG NAVAL GUARD
turns.text: General McAddie's.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: General McAddie is who requested our coming here. We were awakened at three AM and told to get down here immediately.

turns.speaker: YOUNG NAVAL GUARD
turns.text: I don't know anything about that.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Well, call General McAddie.

turns.speaker: YOUNG NAVAL GUARD
turns.text: I don't have his number.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: They can patch you in through the switchboard.

turns.speaker: YOUNG NAVAL GUARD
turns.text: Why don't you go on ahead head and I'll confirm authorization.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: Sit down, they're still talking to Agent Scully.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: -- They're asking her for a narrative. They want to know why she was in the wrong building.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: She was with me.

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: You don't see what's going on here, do you?  There's four hundred million dollars in damage to the city of Dallas. Lives have been lost. No suspects have been named. So the story being shaped is this could have been prevented. That the FBI didn't do its job.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: And they want to blame us?

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: Agent Mulder -- we both know that if you and Agent Scully hadn't taken the initiative to search the adjacent building, you could have multiplied the fatalities by a hundred --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: But it's not the lives we saved. It's the lives we didn't.

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: -- if it looks bad, it's bad for the FBI --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: -- if they want someone to blame, they can blame me. Agent Scully doesn't deserve this.

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: She's in there right now saying the same thing about you.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I breached protocol. I broke contact with the S.A.C. I ignored a primary tactical rule and left him alone with the device.

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: Agent Scully says it was she who ordered you out of the building. That you wanted to go back.

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: Agent Mulder --

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Where's Scully?!

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: She's missing. We've been unable to locate her or the vehicle they took her in.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Whoever they are -- this goes right back to Dallas -- it goes right back to the bombing --

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: I know.  Agent Scully reported your suspicions to OPR. On the basis of her report, I sent techs over to S.A.C. Michaud's apartment. They picked up PSTN residues on his personal effects consistent with the construction of the vending machine device in Dallas.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: How deep does this go?

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Are we being watched?

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: I'm not taking any chances.

turns.speaker: SKINNER
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I've got to find Scully.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Mr. Mulder.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What happened to Kurtzweil?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: He's come and gone.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Where's Scully?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: I have answers for you.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Is she alive?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: I'm quite prepared to tell you everything, though there isn't much you haven't guessed.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: About the conspiracy?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: I think of it as an agreement. A word your father liked to use.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: I want to know where Scully is.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: A weak vaccine against the virus Agent Scully has been infected with. It must be administered with ninety six hours.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: You're lying.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: No. Though I have no way to prove otherwise. The virus is extraterrestrial. We know very little about it, except that it is the original inhabitant of this planet.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: A virus?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: A simple, unstoppable lifeform. What is a virus but a colonizing force that cannot be defeated? Living in a cave, underground, until it mutates. And attacks.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: This is what you've been conspiring to conceal? A disease?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: No! For God sake you've got it all backwards.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Aids, the ebola virus -- on the evolutionary scale they are newborns. This virus walked the planet long before the dinosaurs.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What do you mean, walked?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Your aliens, Agent Mulder, your little green men, first landed here millions of years ago. Those that didn't leave have been laying dormant underground since the last Ice Age. In the form of an evolved pathogen. Waiting to be reconstituted when the alien race from which it came returns to colonize the planet. Using us as hosts. Against this we have no defense. Nothing but a weak vaccine.  Do you see why it was kept secret? Why even the best men -- men like your father -- could not let the truth be known?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Until Dallas, we believed the virus was simply a controlling organism. That mass infection would make us a slave race.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: That's why you bombed the building. The infected firemen, the boy --

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Imagine our surprise when they began to gestate. My group has been working cooperatively with the alien colonists, facilitating their programs. To give us access to the virus. In false hope we might be able to secretly find a cure. So that we might save ourselves, as the last of the species.  Your father wisely refused to believe this, choosing hope over selfishness. Hope is the only future he had: his children,  The only future any of us have.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: But... he sacrificed his own daughter. My sister, Samantha.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: The only true survivors of the viral holocaust will be those immune to it: those vaccinated against it and human/alien hybrids. Your father arranged for your sister's abduction. He allowed her to be taken to an alien hybrid program, so that she would survive. As a clone.  He had different hopes for you. That you would uncover the truth about the Project. That you would stop it. That you would fight the future.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Why are you telling me this?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: I thought it only fair you should know, given how hard you've worked.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What happened to Kurtzweil?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: As your father knew, things need to be sacrificed to the future.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Dr. Kurtzweil is in the trunk.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: Let me out. Stop the car.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Driver.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: You have precious little time. What I've given you the alien colonists have no idea exists. You hold in your hand the power to end the project.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: The vaccine you hold is the only defense against the virus. Its introduction into an alien environment may have the power to destroy the delicate plans we've so assiduously protected for the last fifty years.  Or it may not.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What alien environment?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Find Agent Scully. Save her. Only her science can save the future.

turns.speaker: MULDER
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: My life is over.  Go.

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: We began to worry. Some of us have traveled so far, and you are the last to arrive.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: I'm sorry. My grandson fell and broke his leg.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: More concerns than that?

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: We've been forced to reassess our role in Colonization by new facts of biology which have presented themselves.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: My god...

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: The geometry of mass infection presents certain conceptual re-evaluations for us. About our place in their Colonization.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: This isn't Colonization, it's spontaneous repopulation. All our work... if it's true, then they've been using us all along. We've been laboring under a lie!

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: We're going to tell them what we've found. What we've learned. Turn over a body infected with the gestating organism.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: In hope of what? Learning that it's true?! That we are nothing more than digestives for the creation of a new race of alien lifeforms?!

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: Let me remind you who is the new race. And who is the old.  What could be gained by withholding anything from them; By pretending to ignorance? Our knowledge may forestall their plans to step up the timetable. To start Colonization early.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: And if it doesn't? By cooperating now we're but beggars to our demise! Our ignorance was in cooperating with the Colonists at all.

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: Cooperation is our only chance of saving ourselves.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: Our vaccine may have no effect!

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: Well, without a cure for the virus, we're nothing more than digestives anyway.

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: We've allowed this man his freedom. His books have actually helped us to facilitate plausible denial. Has he outlived his usefulness to us?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: No one believes Kurtzweil or his books. He's a toiler. A crank.

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: And Mulder?

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: You can't kill Mulder. He's got too much light on him.

turns.speaker: STRUGHOLD
turns.text: You need not kill a man to destroy him.

turns.speaker: WELL-MANICURED MAN
turns.text: No, you need only take away what is most precious to him.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Sing a song of sixpence...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: A pocketful of rye...

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Four-and-twenty blackbirds.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Did we go sailing?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Almost.  Mocky-Lock showed up.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: "Mocky-Lock is the bogeyman, Mocky-Lock wants me where I am."

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Mocky-Lock is a pain in the ass.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: He hates me.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Lucien Baines?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: She adores you.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: She thinks I can bring Edward back.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Someday you can.  We all believe that...

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: We've been over this a dozen times.  No.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Why not?  Just once.  A trial run.  What harm could it do?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I don't want to find out.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Miriam...

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Shush.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: He creates the obstacles, he decides which games to play.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I've heard this argument before.  It's not happening.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: It could take years for me to get past the barriers he's created.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: If we reverse the feed and bring Edward into your mind, it could be devastating for him.  Imagine the shock of suddenly existing in a whole other world.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I do it all the time!

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Yes, but, you're a willing participant. Picture Edward in a strange place, lost, frightened...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'd be there for him.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: And he might blame you for terrifying him.  That one moment could erase all you've accomplished.  And if that happened, the trust he has in you is gone.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Okay, okay...

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: You're sure?  Any more nightmares?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Good.  We need you healthy and relaxed. You're going to eat well, meditate, exercise, and watch mindless television.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Yes mother.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I don't want you up all night reading Edward's case file of the nine millionth time.  Balance, dear girl, is the key. Leave the work here.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Don't bring it home in this.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Henry wants me to try this Vietnamese place he's wild about.  Want to come?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I've got to feed my cat.  Besides, I want to get to bed early.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: That's my girl.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Sing a song of sixpence.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: A pocketful of fucking rye.  What's wrong?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Why did we stop?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: The first... What?  Six or seven times I went in.   Remember what happened?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Disorientation, nausea, migraines, hallucinations, insomnia, paranoia.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Like a New Year's Day hangover.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: He needs to be turned over.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: This isn't your responsibility. Remember that.  Don't let them use guilt as a tool.  If you want to stop, say so.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I'll be fine.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: She said convincingly.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Catherine?  I'm about to start.  If you want me to wait, or...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No.  No.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Is it cold in here?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: ...a pocketful of rye.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Four and twenty blackbirds...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Baked in a pie.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Damn him.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Agent Novak.  I didn't get a chance to clear him.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I refilled the Zyprexa and Atavan...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I don't need them anymore...

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I'll come by tomorrow after work.  With dinner.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Thanks Miriam.  Say hi to Henry and...

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: ...give a kiss to Edward.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Give a kiss to Edward.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: What if he wasn't like this?  What if he was "normal?"  Conscious.  How far would you go?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: As far as I needed.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: There's always a chance they'll confess.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Really?  I don't work with violent cases, I work with children.  But even a kid lies.  They love it when they get you to believe something that isn't true.  Don't you think Stargher would do the same?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Sometimes... Once they've been caught they feel a need for disclosure.  They have so much they want to tell. But they've never had a sympathetic ear. They need someone to understand why.  Stargher used to hide the bodies very carefully.  It was part of the ritual. Some weren't found for weeks and any physical evidence had been meticulously wiped clean.  But these last three... They were still in water - always in water - but  Listen, he wasn't just careless.  It went beyond that...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Okay.  Let's assume he wanted you to find him, that some part of him hated what he was doing... Most likely, that part is dead.  Schizophrenics with Whalen's Infraction sever all ties with the real world.  I'm sorry, I really am.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: I still don't understand why I can't do this... This isn't some "troubled kid" you're dealing with.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I realize that...

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: How hard could it be...?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: This man is deeply disturbed, he...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: You don't know the procedure.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: I know him.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Edward Baines, I presume.  Hi, Ed.  I'm Pete.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Do you think that's funny?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: No.  Not at all.  From what I understand, he knows I"m here, isn't that right?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: I read about a woman in TExas who was in a coma for seven years.  Every time her husband came to visit, her heart would beat faster.  Isn't that something?  I don't know what name scientists have for something like that...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: It doesn't have much to do with science.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: What then?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: The soul.  The spirit.  Whatever you want to call it.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Ah, the part of us that can't be explained.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Agent Novak?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Peter, okay?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Do you feel there's a side of yourself you don't show people?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Absolutely.  I suppose everyone does.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Just like we all have fantasies, right? Things only we know, that we don't share.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: That's what therapists are for, right?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: With Stargher I saw things...

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: What did you see?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: A kingdom.  His utopia. Life without consequence or restriction. He's not even Carl Stargher anymore. He's this... idealized version of himself who can do anything he pleases... Without fear.  A horrible primitive ugly thing.  I don't want to talk in here.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Why'd you bring him here?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: You're the shrink, you tell me.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: As soon as I met him, you knew I'd say yes.  He makes Julia real for me.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: You thought Stargher wanted to be caught.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: I did, yeah.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: You were right.  There's a part of him that knows the truth.  About what he did, about himself.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: What about Julia?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: This is going to sound terrible, but... I don't think she matters anymore.  Not to him.  He never finished her.  The others...he was able to make them his.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: You think you can do this, don't you?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: He might tell me about Julia.  The part of him that wants to help, that feels shame and remorse.  Who wants to be redeemed.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: This is Stargher we're talking about?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Not Stargher, not really.  He's split himself right down the middle. Good/evil, right/wrong, merciful/cruel. A monster.  And an innocent child.  If I could reach the boy.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Whoa.  Hold on.  Aren't they the same guy?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Don't you feel there are different sides to every personality?  Maybe even the worst of us is capable of one decent act.  We're all human.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: It's hard for me to see Stargher as human, capable of something like "remorse."

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Then what is he?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Evil.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: If you believe that.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Maybe this is a big fucking waste of time.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: What happened to Charles Gish?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: What difference does it make...?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: A child can experience abuse worse than Charlie's.  And grow up to be someone who would never, ever hurt another living thing.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: You're sure of that?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Yes.  I am.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Remember, Julia Hickson is priority number one.  Nothing else matters.  Find out where she is.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Okay, okay...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Wait...

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Like hell "wait."

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: He wants us to follow.  The little boy...

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Little boy?!  That's him!

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: He brought you to me, didn't he?  If you want Julia to live, trust me.  Trust him.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Where the hell are we?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Carl, do you know?  Like on a map...

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: COME ON!

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I can't leave him!

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: That went well.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Give her a minute.  Hello, Valentine.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: You sure about this?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Absolutely.  Abigail...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I heard Julia and John got married.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Yep.  Eloped.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Good for them.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Well look at that.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I told you.  You have to be optimistic. Believe in them...

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: So you say.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: He's mine?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: All yours.  My boss says it's one of the strangest requests the Bureau's ever had.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: He also says that until proven differently, Julia Hickson was found as a result of good old-fashioned detective work.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: It doesn't matter...

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: I don't know.  I think it does.  You know, Catherine... If you ever want to talk about it.  What happened to Stargher.  That last time.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: They're hungry.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: I got it.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: No.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You liked him?

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: He's beautiful...

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: What now?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: 's broken.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Who says?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Mocky-Lock.

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: Oh no... No you don't.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: "Mocky-Lock is the bogeyman.  Mocky-Lock wants me where I am."

turns.speaker: CATHERINE
turns.text: I bet we can fix it.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: She the one from Santa Cruz?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Just graduated law school.  Single mom. Had a two-year-old daughter.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Agent Cole.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: I need you to find something in the basement...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Already there.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: That hoist, with the winch...

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Lattimer sold the hoist to a guy named Bainbridge who tired to build a machine works out near Delano.  Bainbridge ends up in bankruptcy court and the state winds up with the land - it's just sitting there.

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: Delano?

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: Yep.  And guess who they hired to seal up the place?

turns.speaker: NOVAK
turns.text: You're kidding me.

turns.speaker: COLE
turns.text: I never kid.  My wife hates it.  Says I'm too serious.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Shouldn't we get a catheter in him?

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: They took care of that, thank you, Henry.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Not a gift.  A highly evolved area in her cerebral cortex, that's all.  A genetic fluke.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Catherine has a tremendous capacity for empathy.  When we started, there were a number of test subjects - other therapists - who acted as "receivers."  All they did was observe and report.  Nothing more.  But Catherine, she had the ability to feel what was happening.  She understood. And the patient responded.  Edward engaged her in dialogue, took her places, showed her things.  He knew she cared.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Intravenous administration complete.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: Initiating connection.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: That's why we monitor the use of the drugs so closely.  We don't want her getting to that degree of perceptual disorientation.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: Pump in two liters of pure oxygen, please Henry.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: I hate to admit it, but there's something perversely satisfying about this.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: I think that's the whole point.

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: She changed the codes.

turns.speaker: MIRIAM
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: HENRY
turns.text: It would take hours to re-route the system, and even if I did, I shouldn't.
